<Link id="l00212" /><CodeLine lineNumber="212"><Highlight kind="comment">  /// Commutes the operands in the given instruction by changing the operands</Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00213" /><CodeLine lineNumber="213"><Highlight kind="comment">  /// order and/or changing the instruction&#39;s opcode and/or the immediate value</Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00214" /><CodeLine lineNumber="214"><Highlight kind="comment">  /// operand.</Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00215" /><CodeLine lineNumber="215"><Highlight kind="comment">  ///</Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00216" /><CodeLine lineNumber="216"><Highlight kind="comment">  /// The arguments &#39;CommuteOpIdx1&#39; and &#39;CommuteOpIdx2&#39; specify the operands</Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00217" /><CodeLine lineNumber="217"><Highlight kind="comment">  /// to be commuted.</Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00218" /><CodeLine lineNumber="218"><Highlight kind="comment">  ///</Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00219" /><CodeLine lineNumber="219"><Highlight kind="comment">  /// Do not call this method for a non-commutable instruction or</Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00220" /><CodeLine lineNumber="220"><Highlight kind="comment">  /// non-commutable operands.</Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00221" /><CodeLine lineNumber="221"><Highlight kind="comment">  /// Even though the instruction is commutable, the method may still</Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00222" /><CodeLine lineNumber="222"><Highlight kind="comment">  /// fail to commute the operands, null pointer is returned in such cases.</Highlight><Highlight kind="normal"></Highlight></CodeLine>
